org.openhab.binding.adorne.internal.hub

Class AdorneHubController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.adorne.internal.hub.AdorneHubController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    @NonNullByDefault
public class AdorneHubController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The AdorneHubController manages the interaction with the Adorne hub. The controller maintains a connection with the Adorne Hub and listens to device changes and issues device commands. Interaction with the hub is performed asynchronously through REST messages.
    Author:
    Mark Theiding - Initial Contribution

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Void> start()
        Start the hub controller. Call only once.
        Returns:
        Future to inform the caller that the hub controller is ready for receiving commands

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the hub controller. Can't restart afterwards.

      • stopWhenCommandsServed

        public void stopWhenCommandsServed()
        Stops the hub controller once all in-flight commands have been executed.

      • stopBy

        public void stopBy(long stopTimestamp)
        Stops the hub controller after a certain point in time.
        Parameters:
        stopTimestamp - timestamp to stop after

      • setOnOff

        public void setOnOff(int zoneID,
                     boolean on)
        Turns device on or off.
        Parameters:
        zoneID - the device's zone ID
        on - true to turn on the device

      • setBrightness

        public void setBrightness(int zoneID,
                          int level)
        Sets the brightness for a device. Applies only to dimmer devices.
        Parameters:
        zoneID - the device's zone ID
        level - A value from 1-100. Note that in particular value 0 is not supported, which means this method can't be used to turn off a dimmer.

      • getState

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<org.openhab.binding.adorne.internal.AdorneDeviceState> getState(int zoneID)
        Gets asynchronously the state for a device.
        Parameters:
        zoneID - the device's zone ID
        Returns:
        a future for the AdorneDeviceState

        Returns:
        a future for the list of zone IDs
